Package io.github.humbleui.skija

Class Matrix33

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.humbleui.skija.Matrix33
  • public class Matrix33
extends java.lang.Object

    Matrix holds a 3x3 matrix for transforming coordinates. This allows mapping Point and vectors with translation, scaling, skewing, rotation, and perspective.

    Matrix includes a hidden variable that classifies the type of matrix to improve performance. Matrix is not thread safe unless getType() is called first.

    See Also:
    https://fiddle.skia.org/c/@Matrix_063

    • Field Detail

      • _mat

        @Internal
public final float[] _mat

        Matrix33 elements are in row-major order.

        
 | scaleX   skewX  transX |
 |  skewY  scaleY  transY |
 | persp0  persp1  persp2 |

      • IDENTITY

        @NotNull
public static final @NotNull Matrix33 IDENTITY
        An identity Matrix33: 
        
 | 1 0 0 |
 | 0 1 0 |
 | 0 0 1 |

    • Method Detail

      • makeTranslate

        @NotNull
@Contract("_, _ -> new")
public static @NotNull Matrix33 makeTranslate​(float dx,
                                              float dy)

        Creates a Matrix33 to translate by (dx, dy). Returned matrix is:

        
 | 1 0 dx |
 | 0 1 dy |
 | 0 0  1 |
        Parameters:
        dx - horizontal translation
        dy - vertical translation
        Returns:
        Matrix33 with translation

      • makeScale

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull Matrix33 makeScale​(float s)

        Creates a Matrix33 to scale by s. Returned matrix is:

        
 | s 0 0 |
 | 0 s 0 |
 | 0 0 1 |
        Parameters:
        s - scale factor
        Returns:
        Matrix33 with scale

      • makeScale

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull Matrix33 makeScale​(float sx,
                                          float sy)

        Creates a Matrix33 to scale by (sx, sy). Returned matrix is:

         
 | sx  0  0 |
 |  0 sy  0 |
 |  0  0  1 |
        Parameters:
        sx - horizontal scale factor
        sy - vertical scale factor
        Returns:
        Matrix33 with scale

      • makeConcat

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Matrix33 makeConcat​(Matrix33 other)

        Creates Matrix33 by multiplying this by other. This can be thought of mapping by other before applying Matrix.

        Given:

        
        | A B C |          | J K L |
 this = | D E F |, other = | M N O |
        | G H I |          | P Q R |

        Returns:

         
                | A B C |   | J K L |   | AJ+BM+CP AK+BN+CQ AL+BO+CR |
 this * other = | D E F | * | M N O | = | DJ+EM+FP DK+EN+FQ DL+EO+FR |
                | G H I |   | P Q R |   | GJ+HM+IP GK+HN+IQ GL+HO+IR |
        Parameters:
        other - Matrix on right side of multiply expression
        Returns:
        this multiplied by other

      • makeRotate

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull Matrix33 makeRotate​(float deg)
        Creates a Matrix33 to rotate by |deg| about a pivot point at (0, 0).
        Parameters:
        deg - rotation angle in degrees (positive rotates clockwise)
        Returns:
        Matrix33 with rotation

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull Matrix33 makeRotate​(float deg,
                                           io.github.humbleui.types.Point pivot)
        Creates a Matrix33 to rotate by |deg| about a pivot point at pivot.
        Parameters:
        deg - rotation angle in degrees (positive rotates clockwise)
        pivot - pivot point
        Returns:
        Matrix33 with rotation

      • makeRotate

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull Matrix33 makeRotate​(float deg,
                                           float pivotx,
                                           float pivoty)
        Creates a Matrix33 to rotate by |deg| about a pivot point at (pivotx, pivoty).
        Parameters:
        deg - rotation angle in degrees (positive rotates clockwise)
        pivotx - x-coord of pivot
        pivoty - y-coord of pivot
        Returns:
        Matrix33 with rotation

      • makeSkew

        @NotNull
public static @NotNull Matrix33 makeSkew​(float sx,
                                         float sy)

        Creates a Matrix33 to skew by (sx, sy). Returned matrix is:

         
 | 1  sx  0 |
 | sy  1  0 |
 |  0  0  1 |
        Parameters:
        sx - horizontal skew factor
        sy - vertical skew factor
        Returns:
        Matrix33 with skew

      • asMatrix44

        @NotNull
public @NotNull Matrix44 asMatrix44()

        When converting from Matrix33 to Matrix44, the third row and column remain as identity:

        
 [ a b c ]      [ a b 0 c ]      
 [ d e f ]  ->  [ d e 0 f ]
 [ g h i ]      [ 0 0 1 0 ]      
                [ g h 0 i ]

      • getMat

        public float[] getMat()

        Matrix33 elements are in row-major order.

        
 | scaleX   skewX  transX |
 |  skewY  scaleY  transY |
 | persp0  persp1  persp2 |
